forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain after 4am. Mostly cloudy. Low around 48, with temperatures rising to around 50 overnight. South wind around 5 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Drizzle likely. Mostly cloudy. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 58 in the afternoon. South wind 6 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the night drapes softly over Downtown San Francisco, a faint whisper of rain begins to tease the air, a hint of moisture promising a gentle drizzle that will linger throughout the day. The low temperature hovers around 48, but it will inch upwards, as the South wind carries the scent of the Pacific, weaving through the city's iconic streets. The dawn will be shrouded in clouds, a thick blanket that might break in the afternoon, when the temperature retreats slightly to the mid-fifties. 

Visibility is tempered today, with pockets of mist curling around the hills and hinting at where the marine layer plays hide and seek with the semi-hidden silhouette of the Golden Gate Bridge. The urban landscape appears muted, sculpted by the clouds, yet it is a peaceful canvas begging for exploration. A light jacket or a windbreaker will be your best companions, perhaps layered over a comfortable sweater for those who appreciate the textured embrace of a chilly November day. There’s solace to find in wandering the quieter neighborhoods, perhaps a leisurely stroll along the Embarcadero or indulging in a quiet café moment while rain dances softly against the windows, transforming the ordinary into something exquisite—an opportunity to savor the textures of city life as it unfurls under gray skies.
